TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit IssuedTokenClientCredential extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents information used to obtain an issued token from a security token service.

remarks.format:
## Examples This code illustrates one way to create an instance of this object.
[!code-csharp[c_CreateSTS#30](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_creatests/cs/source.cs#30)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean that specifies whether issued tokens are to be cached by the channel.
Docs.value: if tokens are to be cached; otherwise, . The default value is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the default value of .
Docs.value: The value of . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the client does WS-Trust exchange with the Security Token Service to obtain the issued token, it sometimes must exchange key entropy with the Security Token Service to arrive at a shared symmetric key. The Security Token Service typically specifies the entropy exchange mechanism to use in its binding. If no such mechanism is specified in the Security Token Service's binding, the `DefaultKeyEntropyMode` value is used to exchange entropy with the Security Token Service.
## Examples This code shows how to set this property.
[!code-csharp[c_CreateSTS#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_creatests/cs/source.cs#17)] [!code-vb[c_CreateSTS#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_creatests/vb/source.vb#17)]

Docs.exception: An attempt was made to a read-only credential.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the renewal threshold percentage for issued tokens.
Docs.value: The renewal threshold percentage for issued tokens. The default value is 60.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The client caches issued tokens and when a cached issued token is going to expire in the near future, the client automatically gets a fresh issued token from the Security Token Service. The value of this property determines what percentage of the cached issued token's validity period must be over before getting a fresh issued token.
For example, if this property's value is 60, and the client gets an issued token that is valid for 100 minutes, it reuses the cached issued token for 60 minutes, after which it gets a fresh issued token from the Security Token Service.
## Examples This code shows how to set this property.
[!code-csharp[c_CreateSTS#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_creatests/cs/source.cs#16)] [!code-vb[c_CreateSTS#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_creatests/vb/source.vb#16)]

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of issuer channel behaviors.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The dictionary keys are the URIs of the Security Token Services that the client wants to communicate with. The entry for each URI is a <xref:System.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection%601> of the endpoint behaviors that the application uses in the channels created by [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to get the issued tokens from the Security Token Services.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the address of the local issuer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When obtaining an issued token from a Security Token Service, the client application must be configured with the address of the Security Token Service. This information can be specified by the target service in its security policy. In case the target service does not specify this information in its security policy, the client's [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] channel uses the `LocalIssuerAddress` as the address of the Security Token Service from which to obtain the issued token.
## Examples This code shows how to set this property.
[!code-csharp[c_CreateSTS#31](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_creatests/cs/source.cs#31)]

Docs.exception: An attempt was made to a read-only credential.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the binding of the local issuer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When obtaining an issued token from a Security Token Service, the client application must be configured with the binding to use to communicate with the Security Token Service. In case the target service does not specify information about the Security Token Service in its security policy, the client's [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] channel uses the LocalIssuerBinding as the binding to use to communicate with the Security Token Service.
## Examples This code shows how to set this property.
[!code-csharp[c_CreateSTS#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_creatests/cs/source.cs#13)] [!code-vb[c_CreateSTS#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_creatests/vb/source.vb#13)]

Docs.exception: An attempt was made to a read-only credential.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of local issuer channel behaviors.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is a <xref:System.Collections.Generic.KeyedByTypeCollection%601> of the endpoint behaviors that the application uses in the channels created by [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] to get the issued tokens from the local Security Token Service.
## Examples This code shows how to set this property.
[!code-csharp[c_CreateSTS#32](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_creatests/cs/source.cs#32)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum caching time for an issued token.
Docs.value: A that represents the maximum caching time for an issued token. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, issued tokens obtained from the Security Token Service are cached by the [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] client channel. This property enables the application to specify the maximum time that the channel caches the issued token.
## Examples This code shows how to set this property.
[!code-csharp[c_CreateSTS#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_creatests/cs/source.cs#15)] [!code-vb[c_CreateSTS#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_creatests/vb/source.vb#15)]
